header_summary:
Bitcoin developers have been actively debating enhancements to the protocol, including a proposed fix to the replace-by-fee rules outlined in BIP-125 Rule 2 to address scenarios where unconfirmed inputs from different replaced transactions could be combined, potentially making the transaction less appealing to miners. The proposed change, which would require all unconfirmed inputs in a replacement transaction to originate from the same transaction, is detailed at https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/26451, although it may limit some rare transaction replacements.

Furthermore, the upcoming Bitcoin Core v26.0 will incorporate Antoine Riard's full-RBF peering code, a significant update that allows nodes with full-RBF to connect with peers that support the feature, which is detailed by Peter Todd at https://petertodd.org/2023/why-you-should-run-mempoolfullrbf and the source code is available at https://github.com/petertodd/bitcoin/tree/full-rbf-v26.0. Additionally, the BitBlend proposal aims to address the 2106 timestamp overflow issue through a backward-compatible reinterpretation of the timestamp field, with a white paper available for community review at https://bitblend2106.github.io/bitcoin/BitBlend2106.pdf.

In terms of security, a differential fuzzing technique has identified a bug in open-source software, with a detailed report and harness code forthcoming to bolster software reliability. Moreover, Taprootized Atomic Swaps (TAS) represent a leap in cross-chain transactions and privacy through the use of Schnorr signatures, Taproot, and zero-knowledge proofs; documentation is available at https://docs.google.com/document/d/1mVMElv5smDalqD67D9zniwfFfmSg2badeAIZwgW-0kU/editheading=h.nikv26elm71x. Lastly, an enhanced analysis tool for Bitcoin and Elements scripts now supports dynamic opcode analysis and improved malleability analysis, with the updated tool accessible via its GitHub repository.

recent_posts.title: One-Shot Replace-By-Fee-Rate
recent_posts.summary:
- Issue with Bitcoin's replace-by-fee rules affects high to low fee-rate transaction replacements.
- A GitHub pull request proposes a solution ensuring all inputs in replacements are from the same transaction.
- Permission is sought to use graphics in educational materials on replace-by-fee-rate issues.

recent_posts.title: Full-RBF Peering Bitcoin Core v26.0 Released
recent_posts.summary:
- Bitcoin Core v26.0 features full-RBF, allowing nodes to signal and connect for robust propagation.
- Full-RBF adoption isn't mandatory but benefits the network when more users enable it.
- Peter Todd runs v26.0 nodes with v2transport=1; source code available on GitHub for download.

recent_posts.title: BitBlend Proposal for 2106
recent_posts.summary:
- BitBlend proposes a non-disruptive fix for Bitcoin's 2106 timestamp overflow using a dual-time representation.
- The solution modifies time locks post-2106, favoring block height and relative time locks for compatibility.
- Feedback on BitBlend is invited via a detailed white paper and Proton Mail for collaborative refinement.

recent_posts.title: Disclosure: Btcd consensus bugs due to usage of signed transaction version
recent_posts.summary:
- The blog post details bug discovery in OSS using differential fuzzing.
- It underscores fuzzing's role in enhancing software security and reliability.
- The upcoming release will benefit those interested in such debugging techniques.

recent_posts.title: Untraceable Taprootized Atomic Swaps
recent_posts.summary:
- Taprootized Atomic Swaps enhance privacy in cryptocurrency exchanges using Schnorr signatures and zero-knowledge proofs.
- The TAS protocol starts with parties exchanging public keys and creating secure transactions with escrow keys.
- Practical TAS implementation advises MuSig, P2TR, Poseidon hash function, and the 0xPARC library for efficiency and security.

recent_posts.title: B'SST: Bitcoin-like Script Symbolic Tracer v0.1.2 released
recent_posts.summary:
- An updated Bitcoin analysis tool offers enhanced features and user experience improvements.
- New plugin system and opcode analysis support expand analytical possibilities and precision.
- Additional report details and plugins aid in malleability analysis and size variation understanding.

active_posts.title: Compressed Bitcoin Transactions
active_posts.summary:
- Tom Briar developed a bitcoin transaction compression schema for low bandwidth channels.
- The schema ensures common single-party transactions remain intact during transmission.
- Tom submitted a pull request for the schema's implementation.

active_posts.title: BIP process friction
active_posts.summary:
- The BIPs repository struggles with merging issues and a narrowing scope for acceptable proposals.
- Luke is the sole editor able to assign BIP numbers, causing additional delays.
- Aj created BINANA, an alternative number assignment system, and suggests BIPs need reform.

active_posts.title: [BUG]: Bitcoin blockspace price discrimination put simple transactions at disadvantage
active_posts.summary:
- Disproportional cost in blockspace allocation favors complex over simple transactions.
- A uniform pricing strategy suggesting equal value per byte is proposed for fairness.
- Implementing this in a Segwit update may remedy inefficiencies, pending community feedback.

active_posts.title: V3 transaction policy for anti-pinning
active_posts.summary:
- Gloria Zhao proposed the "V3" transaction relay policy for Bitcoin network issues.
- Greg Sanders suggested ephemeral anchors to complement V3's approach.
- A Bitcoin Core pull request details the V3 policy design specifications.

active_posts.title: 64 bit arithmetic soft fork
active_posts.summary:
- 64-bit arithmetic has been deemed necessary for enabling TLUV and other protocols.
- A Bitcoin Improvement Proposal addressing this need is open for public evaluation.
- Early feedback on both the proposal and its implementation is currently sought.

active_posts.title: Unspendable keys in descriptors
active_posts.summary:
- Taproot integration in Bitcoin Core enables new wallet development challenges.
- Various methods to create unique, indistinguishable unspendable keys have trade-offs.
- Long-term solutions may require descriptor syntax additions for broad adoption.

today_in_history_posts.title: Transaction Merging (bip125 relaxation)
today_in_history_posts.summary:
- The author suggests revising bip125 to enable merging multiple unconfirmed transactions.
- Transaction merging is hindered by difficulties in managing replaced transactions that get confirmed.
- A proposed solution involves marking only transactions with change as replaceable for immediate payment.

today_in_history_posts.title: lightning operation during / following a chain fork (e.g. BIP 50)
today_in_history_posts.summary:
- The email addresses consensus among lightning nodes during or after a blockchain fork.
- Channel_announcement messages identify currency with a chain_hash, questioning existing channel management post-fork.
- The author inquires if intentional and unintentional fork scenarios have been analyzed or remain unaddressed.

today_in_history_posts.title: Deflationary money is a Good Thing
today_in_history_posts.summary:
- Passive investment involves acquiring assets with minimal management.
- Active investment necessitates direct interaction with asset development and utilization.
- Economic stability might improve with a central bank-issued currency backed by Bitcoin.
